headline.main: Former North Carolina Law Enforcement Officers Admit to Drug Scheme
headline.print_headline: Former North Carolina Law Enforcement Officers Admit to Drug Scheme

docs.snippet: Fourteen people, including 12 former sheriff's officers and correctional officers, have pleaded guilty to a drug dealing conspiracy centered in a North Carolina county, the U.S. Department of Justice announced on Tuesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Fourteen people, including 12 former sheriff's officers and correctional officers, have pleaded guilty to a drug dealing conspiracy centered in a North Carolina county, the U.S. Department of Justice announced on Tuesday.

headline.main: Forensic Team Finds Remains in Mexico Dump, but No Sign of 43 Students
headline.print_headline: Forensic Team Finds Remains in Mexico Dump, but No Sign of 43 Students

docs.snippet: Argentine forensics experts said on Tuesday they had found the remains of 19 people in a dump in southwestern Mexico where the government claimed 43 missing students were incinerated in 2014, but no sign of the students....
docs.lead_paragraph: Argentine forensics experts said on Tuesday they had found the remains of 19 people in a dump in southwestern Mexico where the government claimed 43 missing students were incinerated in 2014, but no sign of the students.

headline.main: Exclusive: In Boost to Self-Driving Cars, U.S. Tells Google Computers Can Qualify as Drivers
headline.print_headline: Business Briefing; Step Toward Approval for Self-Driving Autos

docs.snippet: U.S. vehicle safety regulators have said the artificial intelligence system piloting a self-driving Google car could be considered the driver under federal law, a major step toward ultimately winning approval for autonomous vehicles on the roads....
docs.abstract: National Highway Traffic Safety Administration says artificial intelligence system controlling self-driving Google car could be considered driver under federal law; decision marks step toward approval for autonomous vehicles.
docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. vehicle safety regulators have said the artificial intelligence system piloting a self-driving Google car could be considered the driver under federal law, a major step toward ultimately winning approval for autonomous vehicles on the roads.

headline.main: Win Over Liverpool Was One of West Ham's Greatest-Bilic

docs.snippet: Fans with long memories may disagree but West Ham United manager Slaven Bilic believes their last-gasp, extra-time win over Liverpool on Tuesday will go down as one of the London club's greatest triumphs....
docs.lead_paragraph: Fans with long memories may disagree but West Ham United manager Slaven Bilic believes their last-gasp, extra-time win over Liverpool on Tuesday will go down as one of the London club's greatest triumphs.

headline.main: Japan January Wholesale Prices Fall 3.1 Percent Year-On-Year
headline.print_headline: Japan January Wholesale Prices Fall 3.1 Percent Year-On-Year

docs.snippet: Japanese wholesale prices fell 3.1 percent in the year to January, Bank of Japan data showed on Wednesday....
docs.lead_paragraph: Japanese wholesale prices fell 3.1 percent in the year to January, Bank of Japan data showed on Wednesday.

docs.snippet: VERDY--Violette. The entire New York City Ballet family mourns the passing of Violette Verdy, our dear friend and colleague, and one of the great ballerinas of the 20th century. Born in France, where she began an acclaimed international career, Vi...
docs.lead_paragraph:
VERDY--Violette.

The entire New York City Ballet family mourns the passing of Violette Verdy, our dear friend and colleague, and one of the great ballerinas of the 20th century. Born in France, where she began an acclaimed international career, Violette danced with New York City Ballet from 1958 until 1977. During that time her unique gifts inspired both George Balanchine and Jerome Robbins to create roles for her in such masterpieces as "Emeralds," "Liebeslieder Walzer," "Tschaikovsky Pas de Deux," and "Dances at a Gathering." Also a renowned teacher, Violette has touched the lives of countless young dancers with her knowledge, charm, grace, and joie de vivre. She will be greatly missed.

docs.snippet: TISHMAN--John. The Board and Staff of NRDC mourn the passing of John L. Tishman, the beloved father of our esteemed chairman, Daniel R. Tishman. A University of Michigan graduate who served in the United States Navy, John was a father of the moder...
docs.lead_paragraph:
TISHMAN--John.

The Board and Staff of NRDC mourn the passing of John L. Tishman, the beloved father of our esteemed chairman, Daniel R. Tishman. A University of Michigan graduate who served in the United States Navy, John was a father of the modern American construction industry. He supervised the construction of some of the world's most iconic skyscrapers, including the John Hancock Center in Chicago, IL and the twin towers of the World Trade Center in New York. Tishman Realty and Construction Company was in the vanguard of the sustainable design movement, and the New School named its Tishman Environment and Design Center in honor of his achievements. We extend our deepest sympathies to Dan, his wife Sheryl, sons Josh and Gabe, and Dan's sister, Katherine Blacklock and her son Kyle. Rhea Suh, President NRDC; John H. Adams, Trustee & Founding Director; Frances Beinecke, former President

docs.snippet: VERDY--Violette. The School of American Ballet mourns the loss of a beloved family member. Having served as principal guest teacher since 2007, Violette's bond with SAB extends to the 1950s, when as a glamorous star of New York City Ballet she fre...
docs.lead_paragraph:
VERDY--Violette.

The School of American Ballet mourns the loss of a beloved family member. Having served as principal guest teacher since 2007, Violette's bond with SAB extends to the 1950s, when as a glamorous star of New York City Ballet she frequently took classes and guest taught at the direction of George Balanchine. She was instrumental to the launching of SAB's national recruiting program in partnership with the Ford Foundation in the 1960s and 1970s, traveling thousands of miles on the School's behalf to discover talented future dancers nationwide. Our students and all who encountered Violette were touched by her extraordinary generosity of spirit and joyful willingness to share her special gifts. She will be missed enormously.

docs.snippet: KERBS--John S., of Old Greenwich, CT, formerly of New York City, passed away on February 4, 2016. Born November 9, 1926, the youngest son of Jeanne E. Kerbs and William Kallman Kerbs, brother of Edward A. Kerbs and Carlee Kerbs Walker, and loving ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
KERBS--John S.,

of Old Greenwich, CT, formerly of New York City, passed away on February 4, 2016. Born November 9, 1926, the youngest son of Jeanne E. Kerbs and William Kallman Kerbs, brother of Edward A. Kerbs and Carlee Kerbs Walker, and loving husband of Hildegard Johnson Kerbs, all of whom predeceased him. John was a paradigmatic member of that greatest generation. Although he lost a leg and very nearly his life at the age of 15 in an accident at a camp in Vermont, John never complained and scarcely acknowledged that misfortune, quickly returning to his studies at The Lawrenceville School and Yale University. As a young adult, John was active in such adventurous pursuits as hunting, racing midget cars, and flying airplanes before embarking on a career as a stock broker, financial consultant, and businessman. His passion for electronics and technology first developed when he worked with a team of Lawrenceville students rebuilding aircraft engines during WWII, was widely known among his family and friends. Devoted father to his three sons and their wives, Edward and Jean Kerbs, Thomas and Karen Randles Kerbs, and John J. Kerbs and Jennifer Jolley, loving grandfather to John, Julia and Jennifer, John also leaves behind his devoted sister-in-law, Brynne Johnson Solowinski, and numerous nieces and nephews. Services at 3pm on Saturday, February 20th, at the Leo P. Gallagher & Son Funeral Home, 31 Arch St. in Greenwich, CT. He will be missed.

docs.snippet: CEDARBAUM--Miriam Goldman. The judges of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York are deeply saddened by the death of our colleague, and extend our sympathy to her family. Loretta A. Preska, Chief Judge...
docs.lead_paragraph:
CEDARBAUM--Miriam

Goldman. The judges of the United States District Court for the Southern District of New York are deeply saddened by the death of our colleague, and extend our sympathy to her family. Loretta A. Preska, Chief Judge
